intro: Oenothera berlandieri, commonly known as the desert evening primrose, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Onagraceae family and is characterized by its showy, yellow to orange flowers that bloom in the evening. The plant has hairy, branching stems and produces capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in sandy or rocky soils. Oenothera berlandieri is adapted to withstand drought and high temperatures, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
